channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: US drone attack: Three US troops killed in drone strike on US base in Middle East
item.description: President Biden said the attack was carried out by "radical Iran-backed militant groups".

item.title: Disposable vapes to be banned over fears for children's health
item.description: Rishi Sunak announces the plan saying "we must act" to tackle a rise in vaping among children.

item.title: Bristol stabbings: Boys aged 15 and 16 killed in attack
item.description: A 44-year-old man and a boy, 15, have been arrested after an attack in Bristol, say police.

item.title: Nottingham attacks: Special review into NHS trust which treated killer Valdo Calocane
item.description: The review will examine the medical care of Valdo Calocane who killed three people in Nottingham.

item.title: Watch: Moment vibrating phones alerted UN to Russiaâ€™s invasion of Ukraine
item.description: "It was the first I'd heard of it," Russia's ambassador tells the BBC, recalling the night of attack.

item.title: Super Bowl 58: Kansas City Chiefs beat Baltimore Ravens to earn shot at title defence
item.description: The Kansas City Chiefs will play in the Super Bowl for a fourth time in five years after beating the Baltimore Ravens 17-10 in the NFL's Conference Championships.

item.title: Post Office scandal: Chairman Henry Staunton had to go as it 'wasn't working' - Badenoch
item.description: Business Secretary Kemi Badenoch says Henry Staunton's sacking is about more than the Horizon scandal.

item.title: It's a dream come true to work in Urdu with Zayn Malik, say band
item.description: "He is so down to earth, he sang in Urdu, what can be bigger than that?" say Pakistani band Aur.

item.title: Car insurance: Young drivers risk fraud to save on costs
item.description: Insurance industry says young drivers could be tempted to break the law as insurance gets more expensive.

item.title: Train strikes: Passengers facing week of rail disruption
item.description: Members of the Aslef train drivers' union are taking more action in its long-running dispute over pay.

item.title: Weather record for warmest January set in Scottish Highlands
item.description: An unseasonal 19.6C is recorded at Kinlochewe, according to provisional figures from the Met Office.

item.title: British base jumper dies in Thailand after parachute fails
item.description: Police arrived at the eastern Thai beach resort of Pattaya, where they found the 33-year-old's body.

item.title: Watch: Escaped monkey spotted in Highland village
item.description: The Japanese macaque was filmed helping himself from a bird feeder in Kincraig.

item.title: Moti Mahal: India curry houses battle over butter chicken
item.description: Butter chicken - a curry popular around the world - is now in the middle of a court battle in India.

item.title: UNRWA: Key UN Gaza aid agency runs into diplomatic storm
item.description: UNRWA is a lifeline in Gaza, but several countries have paused aid over claims staff helped attack Israel.

item.title: Robert Corfield, ex-minister of secretive sect, admits to child sex abuse
item.description: Alleged victims say predators have gone unpunished for decades in Christian church known as The Truth.

item.title: FA Cup: 'Newport v Man Utd not possible without my dad'
item.description: A teacher took football's authorities to court so Newport could play teams like Manchester United.

item.title: Beauty giant Avon under fire over Russia links
item.description: The firm is facing criticism for continuing production and recruiting new sales agents in Russia.

item.title: OneFour: The rap group dividing Australia
item.description: A standoff between a hip-hop act and law enforcement is fuelling a debate over art and censorship.

item.title: Laura Kuenssberg: What do voters think of party leaders? Not a lot
item.description: Laura Kuenssberg takes a snapshot of what voters in key seats think about the state of politics.

item.title: The Zone of Interest: How Oscars-nominated Auschwitz film borrows from Big Brother
item.description: For The Zone of Interest, hidden crews filmed fictional family life in a house next to the Nazi death camp.

item.title: Would it bother you if you only got mail three days a week?
item.description: Ofcom has proposed Royal Mail could cut the days it delivers letters to three as part of reforms.

item.title: Your pictures on the theme of 'wilderness'
item.description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

item.title: Red Sea: UK navy ship HMS Diamond shoots down Houthi drone
item.description: The Ministry of Defence says this is the third such incident involving HMS Diamond.

item.title: Mona Lisa: Protesters throw soup at da Vinci painting
item.description: The 16th Century painting by Leonardo da Vinci sits behind protective glass at the Louvre in Paris.

item.title: Nadine Dorries pledges to repay mistaken Â£17K exit payout
item.description: The former culture secretary was paid severance pay despite being too old to qualify.

item.title: Fighting in crowd mars Wolves win at West Brom
item.description: Wolves beat West Brom 2-0 at The Hawthorns to reach the fifth round of the FA Cup, after the match is suspended for over half an hour because of crowd trouble.

item.title: Jamie Dornan 'hid' after reviews of Fifty Shades film
item.description: The 2015 film was popular with fans and a box office hit but was critically panned.

item.title: Inside the world's largest cruise ship as it sets sail
item.description: The 20-deck Icon of the Seas' maiden voyage comes amid concerns about the vessel's methane emissions.

item.title: Liverpool fire: Previous concerns about building, councillor says
item.description: There were several concerns about the management of a building before the fire, a councillor says.

item.title: Off-peak Friday fares trial to start for Tube and trains in London
item.description: All Friday journeys on trains and the Tube will be priced at the off-peak rate from March.

item.title: Pembrokeshire skier bags a Welsh hill that rarely sees snow
item.description: A skier hoping to carve on every peak in Wales has bagged one of the country's rarest slopes.

item.title: Singer Morrissey being treated for physical exhaustion
item.description: The singer is being treated in Switzerland after cancelling a number of concerts.

item.title: UK citizen army: Preparing the 'pre-war generation' for conflict
item.description: A senior general stops short of backing conscription - but wants the UK to prepare for wider European war.

item.title: Dragons' Den episode edited after ear seed complaints about Giselle Boxer pitch
item.description: Campaigners say the programme featured "unfounded" health claims about the wellness product.

item.title: Liverpool: Huge fire engulfs building in city centre
item.description: Nearby properties are evacuated as authorities warn people to avoid the area.

item.title: Cuddly toy sellers chase an unlikely audience: 'Kidults'
item.description: Toy and games sales fell last year as family finances were stretched but one group is bucking the trend.

item.title: Xavi: Barcelona manager to leave at end of season
item.description: Barcelona manager Xavi says "the club needs a change of dynamic" and will step down at the end of the season.

item.title: India v England: 'Hyderabad Heist shows England are unmissable'
item.description: The astonishing victory over India in Hyderabad shows why you cannot take your eyes off the England Test team, says Stephan Shemilt.

item.title: 'They were rattled, I was dreaming' - the day Newport scared Man Utd
item.description: Newport fall short of pulling off another shock against Manchester United - but are "proud" of an occasion to savour.

item.title: FA Cup: Newport County 2-4 Manchester United - highlights
item.description: Manchester United survive an FA Cup fourth-round scare at Newport County before finally seeing off the League Two side's brave attempt at a giant-killing.

item.title: Liverpool 0-2 Arsenal: Vivianne Miedema 'feels like herself again' after first goal since ACL injury
item.description: Arsenal's record goalscorer Vivianne Miedema says she "feels like herself again" after scoring her first goal since rupturing her anterior cruciate ligament in December, 2022.

item.title: Keeper hits winning penalty as DR Congo knock out Egypt
item.description: DR Congo beat Egypt 8-7 on penalties after a 1-1 draw to set up a quarter-final against Guinea at the Africa Cup of Nations.

item.title: Jurgen Klopp: Liverpool manager appreciates 'emotional' reception but keen to avoid distraction
item.description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp appreciated the reception afforded to him by supporters prior to Sunday's FA Cup victory over Norwich, but does not want to become a distraction.

item.title: Interest rate and mortgages: What you can do about rising payments
item.description: Watch the BBC's Lora Jones tell you five things you can do about your mortgage, in a minute.

item.title: Interest rates: How the Bank of England's decision affects you and your money
item.description: The Bank of England has held interest rates at 5.25%, but borrowing costs remain comparatively high.

item.title: Mortgage rates: Five ways to save money
item.description: Experts give advice for those who might be worried about their monthly mortgage payments.

item.title: January debt: What should I pay first and what can I do?
item.description: What help and options are available to people struggling with debt repayments?

item.title: Energy saving tips: Five ways to cut costs this winter
item.description: Energy prices will be lower this winter than last - but you may be able to save even more on your bill.
